multiple_choice_question.text: What does the purple curve in Figure 2 represent?
choices: The average normalized binding energy of TFs when target sequences are randomly placed on the DNA.
The average normalized binding energy of TFs when target sequences are at their actual positions in the database.
The difference in binding energy between the search and recognition modes of TFs.
The AT frequency bias around target sequences.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the approximate distance from the target sequence where the AT frequency bias (b(r)) becomes negligible?
What does a positive value of the background frequency bias (Bbkg) indicate?
choices: The target sequence has a higher AT content compared to the genome average.
The region surrounding the target sequence has a higher AT content compared to the genome average.
The TF has a higher affinity for GC-rich sequences.
The funnel effect is absent for that specific target sequence.

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Equation (10), what factor besides the duration of sliding and diffusion rounds, significantly influences the total search time (T(a,k)) of a TF?
choices: The success probability (Ps(a,k)) of finding the target sequence during a sliding round.
The average AT content of the entire genome.
The concentration of roadblocks on the DNA.
